API Reference¶

General functions¶

Helper Functions¶

create_logger(logmodule)
bool2symmetric(data) Changes True/False data to +1/-1 symmetric.
standardize(X[, scaleDict, reverse]) Facilitates standardizing data by subtracting the mean and dividing by the standard deviation.
zeroMatrixDiagonal(X) Set the diagonal of a matrix to all zeros.
getParetoFront(data) Extracts the 2D Pareto-optimal front from a 2D numpy array.
is1D(data) Determine if data is 1-dimensional.
partition(data[, threshold, verbose]) Partitions data into training and test sets.
nmse(yhat, y[, min_y, max_y]) Calculates the normalized mean-squared error.
computeR2(yhat, y) Computes R-squared coefficient of determination.

Models¶

Chip¶

Chip(chip_dict[, LCT_prefix]) Encapsulates chip-level data.

Views¶

syntheticAndReal(sData, bData, d1, d2, filename)
histogram(sData, bData, i[, filename])
yp_vs_y(yp, y[, filename]) This method plots y predicted vs.
qq(x[, filename])
coef_path(coefs) Plot the coefficient paths generated by elastic net / lasso.
pairs(data[, labels, filename]) Generates something similar to R pairs()
te_and_yl(error, errorSyn, filename, description)
laplacianScores(filename, Scores, Ranking)
wafermap(x, y, val[, filename])

Controllers¶

identifyOutliers.identifyOutliers(data[, k]) Compare a dataset against mu +/- k*sigma limits, and
identifyOutliers.identifyOutliersSpecs(data, ...) Compare a dataset against expanded spec limits, and

KDE¶

KDE()
KDE.__init__() Performs non-parametric kernel density estimation.
KDE.run(X[, specs, nSamples, counts, a, bounds]) Primary execution point.
